text: The Priests Are a Snare
Hear this, \add O\add* priests!
Give heed, \add O\add* house of Israel!
Listen, \add O\add* house of the king!
Because the judgment \add applies\add* to you;
because you have been a snare for Mizpah,
and a net spread out on Tabor;
they dug a deep pit\f + \fr 5:2 \ft Hebrew uncertain \f* \add in\add* Shittim,
but I \add am\add* a punishment for all of them.
I myself know Ephraim,
and Israel is not hidden from me;
because now you have played the whore, \add O\add* Ephraim—
Israel is defiled.
Their deeds do not permit them
to return them to God.
Because a spirit of whoredom \add is\add* in their midst,
they do not know Yahweh.
The pride of Israel testifies ⸤against him⸥,\f + \fr 5:5 \ft Literally “against his face;” see 7:10 \f*
and Israel and Ephraim stumble in their guilt,
and Judah stumbles with them.
With their flocks\f + \fr 5:6 \ft Hebrew “flock” \f* and herds\f + \fr 5:6 \ft Hebrew “herd” \f* they will go
to seek Yahweh, but they will not find him;
he has withdrawn from them.
They have dealt faithlessly with Yahweh
because they have borne illegitimate children.
Now \add the\add* new moon will devour them with their fields.
Blow the ⸤horn⸥\f + \fr 5:8 \ft Hebrew “shofar” \f* in Gibeah,
\add the\add* trumpet in Ramah.
Sound the alarm \add in\add* Beth-aven;
\add look\add* behind you, Benjamin.
Ephraim will be a desolation
in the day of punishment;
among the tribes of Israel
I will reveal what is true.
The princes of Judah have become
like those who remove a landmark;
on them I will pour out
my wrath like water.
Ephraim is oppressed,
crushed \add in\add* judgment,
because he was determined
to go after filth.\f + \fr 5:11 \ft Hebrew uncertain; another possible translation is “that he follows human commands” \f*
But I \add am\add* like a maggot to Ephraim
and like rottenness to the house of Judah.
And \add when\add* Ephraim saw his illness,
and Judah his wound,
Ephraim went to Assyria,
he sent to the great king.\f + \fr 5:13 \ft Some translate literally “King Jareb” (see the NASB, NKJV) \f*
But he was unable to cure you
and heal your wound.
Because I \add will be\add* like a lion to Ephraim
and like a fierce strong lion to the house of Judah.
I myself will tear and I will go;
I will carry off, and there is no one who delivers.
⸤I will return again⸥\f + \fr 5:15 \ft Literally “I will go, I will return” \f* to my place
until they acknowledge \add their\add* guilt
and seek my face;
in their distress they will search\f + \fr 5:15 \ft Or “they will beg favor of” \f* me.
